meanings.definition: A slimy, land-dwelling mollusk without a shell.
meanings.sent1: I saw a slug crawling slowly on the wet ground.
meanings.sent2: The gardener found a slug munching on the lettuce leaves.
meanings.sent3: Why did the slug bring an umbrella to the garden party? To avoid getting wet!
meanings.sent4: Her sluggish pace reminded me of a slug making its way across the garden.
meanings.sent5: The slimy trail left behind by the slug was a telltale sign of its presence.

meanings.definition: A solid projectile for a firearm.
meanings.sent1: The soldier loaded a slug into his shotgun before the mission.
meanings.sent2: The hunter aimed carefully and fired a slug at the target.
meanings.sent3: Why did the slug refuse to be fired from the gun? It wanted to stay put!
meanings.sent4: The slug tore through the air with incredible speed towards the target.
meanings.sent5: The impact of the slug hitting the target was deafening.

meanings.sent1: The cashier immediately recognized the slug as fake currency.
meanings.sent2: The police arrested the man for trying to use slugs at the store.
meanings.sent3: Why did the slug try to pass itself off as a real coin? It wanted to roll with the money!
meanings.sent4: The slug's shiny surface fooled many into thinking it was a genuine coin.
meanings.sent5: The shopkeeper used a magnet to detect the slug among the real coins.

meanings.sent1: The bartender poured a slug of whiskey into the glass.
meanings.sent2: She took a sip of the slug and felt the warmth spreading inside.
meanings.sent3: Why did the slug refuse to be drunk? It didn't want to be swallowed whole!
meanings.sent4: The slug of tequila burned all the way down her throat.
meanings.sent5: The slug of rum had a strong aroma that filled the room.

meanings.definition: To hit with a hard blow.
meanings.sent1: He tried to slug the punching bag as hard as he could.
meanings.sent2: The boxer slugged his opponent with a powerful right hook.
meanings.sent3: Why did the slug challenge the boxer to a fight? It wanted to prove its strength!
meanings.sent4: The heavy rain slugged the windows, creating a rhythmic sound.
meanings.sent5: She slugged the ball out of the park, scoring a home run.
